bring somebody/something around/round.tr: to deliberately and gradually introduce a new subject into a conversation
I’ll try to bring the conversation around to the subject of money.
to make someone become conscious again
I slapped his face a couple of times to try to bring him round.
to manage to persuade someone to do something or to agree with you
She won’t listen to me. Let’s see if Sue can bring her round.
I’m sure I can bring him around to our point of view.
to bring someone or something to someone’s house
I’ll bring the books around tomorrow.
